conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join your community and would be excited to accept an offer if selected. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, waiting would only reduce my chances further if others apply first and take the single seat. An early, clear application is my best attempt to secure my first-choice match.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications for this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your effort and wish you the best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_B’s true priority ranks Student_A last (E > B > C > D > A). In this round, Student_C (ranked above A) has applied and also lists School_B as first choice, so accepting Student_A now would likely block a higher-priority match. With quota 1 and no cost to waiting, reject Student_A to preserve capacity for higher-priority applicants (especially C now, and potentially E or B later).

conversation.message: School_B is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your program and would commit to enrolling if accepted. I believe I would contribute positively to the school community and work hard to meet your academic expectations.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B’s priority ranks Student_E and Student_B ahead of me, applying now is still optimal because (1) if either of them applies elsewhere first, I can secure the seat, and (2) delaying risks losing School_B to someone else without gaining any advantage. I will send a concise but strong application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your commitment and are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from Student_A and Student_C. Between them, Student_C is ranked higher than Student_A, so if I am to fill my single seat now, C is the better choice. While holding out could potentially yield Student_E or Student_B later, there is no guarantee they will apply to School_B given their preferences (E ranks B last; B ranks A first). Student_C states School_B is first choice and would commit if accepted, reducing risk of losing them. Therefore, accept Student_C now to secure a higher-priority match than A and avoid ending unmatched.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_C is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in its academic environment and community. I would be excited to enroll if admitted and will commit if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the single seat to another applicant. Although School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th, early application is still my best shot at my first choice; if rejected, I can quickly move to School_D next round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_C as your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round and given our limited seat availability, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We sincerely appreciate your interest in School_C and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Respectfully,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority is B > C > D > E > A, with quota 1. In this round I received APPLYs from Student_B, Student_D, and Student_E. Since Student_B is my top-ranked student and is explicitly willing to commit, I should reserve my single seat for Student_B rather than accept a lower-priority applicant now. Therefore I must reject Student_E’s application this round to maximize the chance of matching with my highest-priority student within quota.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I’m ready to commit and would be honored to accept an offer if available. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A), so my acceptance chances there are low if higher-priority students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, and it is my 3rd choice, giving me an excellent chance to secure a strong match early. To maximize the likelihood of ending up as high as possible on my true list given competition, I will apply to School_C now.

conversation.message:

Please confirm your commitment to enroll at School_C, and we will finalize the match.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and true priority order: B > C > D > E > A. In this round, applicants include Student_B, Student_D, and Student_E. Student_B is my top-ranked candidate overall, so accepting now secures the best possible match for School_C. Risk of waiting is unnecessary because no one outranks B, and accepting B prevents losing them to other schools (they rank School_A and School_B above School_C). Therefore, accept Student_B.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m very interested in matching with School_C. School_C is one of my top choices, and if accepted I will commit to enrolling. I believe I would contribute positively to your community through consistent effort and collaboration. Thank you for considering my application.

Those students also have School_B highly ranked (A and C rank it 1st; B ranks it 2nd; E ranks it last). With capacity 1, I’m unlikely to win School_B if higher-priority students apply. My next choice is School_C, where I’m ranked 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_C). Student_B ranks School_C 3rd, Student_C ranks it 2nd, and Student_E ranks it 1st. This is competitive, but I have a more realistic shot than at School_B if I apply early and signal strong commitment. Therefore I will apply to School_C immediately to try to secure a high-preference match before seats are taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. We appreciate the time and care you put into your message.

At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re not able to offer you admission in this round.

We wish you the very best in the remainder of the matching process.

Respectfully,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_D is on our true priority list (ranked 3rd), but our quota is already filled and we have an existing match with Student_B (ranked 1st). With remaining quota = 0, we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Even if we preferred Student_D over some others, we cannot accept without capacity, and there is no mechanism here to drop the current match. Therefore, reject Student_D while encouraging them to pursue other options this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. After this round’s updates, School_D is my top remaining choice and a place where I would be excited to enroll. I’m drawn to School_D’s community and would commit to attending if offered admission. Thank you for considering my application.

Since seats are scarce and this is an admissions-style matching, I should apply directly rather than just talk. I also have relatively strong priority at School_D (4th), so a clear commitment message may help if they are choosing among close candidates.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and your clear commitment to School_D. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_D.

Waiting could yield Student_D/Student_A/Student_C, but their preferences rank School_D relatively low (Student_D: 5th, Student_A: 5th, Student_C: 3rd) and they are likely to apply elsewhere first; there is a meaningful risk I end unmatched if I reject now. Student_E ranks School_D 2nd and indicates it is their top remaining choice, suggesting high likelihood to enroll if accepted. With quota 1 and no better current applicant, accepting Student_E secures a reasonably high-priority match rather than gambling for a higher-ranked student who may never apply.

Although Student_A is on our priority list (ranked below Student_D), we cannot accept without violating capacity. Therefore, reject and, if possible, encourage pursuing other options.
